title: Still crashes
comment: After two years, it still crashes with threads above around 200 comments.

Thanks for the suggestion, I'm looking quite often at these logs. The problem is related to the way the content is parsed. The app currently uses a DOM/HTML parser (jsoup) which first parses a model of the comments page, and then extracts all comment bodies as Strings. The only way around this would be a streaming parser, which is on my list.

title: Spectator
comment: Can't upvote, can't reply. Other than that, good.

title: Upvote broken
comment: Upvote seems greyed out in current version, can't upvote at all.

title: Works great
comment: Would like to have the ability to add comments
Best app

title: ok
comment: ok
How do you tell what you've upvoted? Would like a dark theme.

title: Can't reply or vote
comment: There is no reply which they have acknowledged and unfortunately no other app seems to have this important feature.  Whenever I try to vote it is grayed out and days already voted. I like the design though.

Thanks for the review! I am not sure who has acknowledged a reply function, but the listing does not state it, so I am unsure why you expect it. We accept PRs though :). Voting seems to work just fine, I'd suggest logging out and back in.

title: Best HN reader but lacking functions
comment: I think this is the best reader for HN based on simplicity alone, but critically it lacks the ability - like all HN readers - to reply to comments. Also it does not give a clear way to up/down vote comments or posts and AFAIK it doesn't actually have that functionality.

Thanks for this review. You can upvote comments by long pressing on them.
Posting comments will be done as soon as we can. We maintain this project in our free time. A PR is welcome :)
best
When opening a link directly from another program it only shows comments. (Open in browser fails) Otherwise it's a good app

Thanks, that is a known issue. We will try to fix that in one of the upcoming builds.
Please report bugs over at github or via email

title: Superb
comment: I love the app. It is really good, precious informative, most important no fecking adds.5*

title: Claims to be open source but isn't
comment: Why is the app called open source if there is a proprietary analytics library in it? It says this was removed on the f-droid version and I wonder why proprietary libraries are being used on an open source app. Otherwise, this app is amazing. Right now it is still hands down the best hacker news application on Android/Linux.

Thank you for this review. There are two reasons why we are trying this out. 1) people forget to (or don't) submit crash reports, 2) we want to see user behaviour to check what features to work on next. However, we respect our users privacy and that is why the tracking is turned off by default. Drop us a line for more info hi@creativepragmatics.com

title: I am leaving
comment: Will open webpages in desktop mode while there is no direct way to share to Chrome
Thanks for this review. I am not sure what you mean, but there is a setting (open articles with system browser), which will use chrome if it is your default browser.

title: Amazing HN reader
comment: Beautifully designed and quite powerful.

Thanks for the review! 
This (loading more) has been fixed in the last version 1.9.10, which just went live.
Please reconsider the 5th star :)

title: Great app with bugs
comment: I like this app, and have used it for a while. It is the best Hacker News app I have encountered so far. I appreciate it's simplicity. I have noticed recently that bugs have been slipping in, but they are generally fixed soon thereafter. Despite this project being available at github, I forget that I could file a bug there.
Easily the best HN reader

title: Learn about Security
comment: Good resource for security topics.

title: Very good
comment: This is the app I've used the most with HN. Quick, simple, and able to open articles with my browser. Unfortunately, I had to uninstall and reinstall recently due to a bug that hid the comment links, and occasionally it crashes with large comment trees, but it's generally good.

title: News updater
comment: Gud news tell u about the world hacking news n speed n rate
Good

title: Daily use
comment: Perfect client

title: Great App
comment: Great App, I really like it. But there doesn't seem to be an easy way to open the article in a browser like Chrome. EDIT: Figured out my way around the app and now it works as I want. 5 stars.

Thanks for this review.
Take a look at the settings. There is an option that you can change to view all articles within the external (system browser).
If you want to view only specific articles in the system browser, then just long press on an article and choose 'External browser'.

title: The best way to read HN on Android.
comment: I use this frequently throughout the day. The interface is intuitive, and the developer is quick to respond when things break outside his control by pushing an update. SO much better than loading the site in a mobile browser.

title: Eh
comment: Ok interface, but can't sign in -  I put in my details and it says unknown error occurred... (edit) after an update I can sign in now and upvote. Improvements are being made. Still no comments
Hey, thanks for the feedback. This is fixed within the latest version. Please reconsider your rating.

title: Works great
comment: Back to being a great mobile reader for hn

HN changed their site structure a bit and the parser was not able to deal with the change.
We have released a new version that should fix the problem. Please update the app and consider changing your review.
Please also do not submit bug reports with reviews for the future. Just ping us or better yet post an issue over at github.
Thanks!

title: My favorite HN app, when it works
comment: One of the better HN apps, but not perfect. Can be buggy, for example, not being able to vote on comments because it thinks you voted already.

Voting should be fixed now. Please try again and consider changing your rating.

title: Post Comments Feature

comment: I've tried a few Hacker News apps and really like this one. The lack of a home screen widget means I need to look elsewhere though :(

title: Excellent
comment: Love this app. Works perfectly. Sometimes links don't work but otherwise it's great. I prefer to use this over my phone's browser because of the word wrap. My only gripe is that you can't see past the top links on the site.

comment: Wonderful interface and seemless sharing function to email articles but unfortunately only displays one more page of stories after hitting the "more" button at the bottom of the page limiting the number of results to just two pages from the hacker news website.  The request "more" stories button disappears after hitting it once so there is no option to view anything past the second page.  Thats a shame as one cant view as much as on the website.

Thanks for this review.
This has been addressed in the last version. Now you load more stories, until HN offers more :)
Please reconsider your rating.

title: My favorite HN...
comment: Could you add a Search function? I would find this invaluable. Thanks.
Basic reader, but needs a facelift
Thanks for the review. The facelift is in progress. Any contribution over at github is much appreciated.

title: Great app

title: Almost perfect

title: Good app
comment: Developer fixed my only complaint so this app is very nice now :)

title: Wow!
comment: Great browsing! Easy to use UI, excellent application. Well done!
Thanks for a great review! High five

title: Good, but I kinda want more
comment: Add a feature to toggle the defferent sorting modes and i'm in love

title: Everything is working again!
comment: Love the update. Great app!

title: Sign-in issue fixed :)
comment: I had the "an unknown error occurred" error when trying to sign in for a while, but it's fixed now and I can go back to using the HN app that I love best.

title: UI needs improving
comment: Solid attempt, but it needs a better interface: Up-vote with one click, hide post until refresh, long press folds comments by default, and a few other things. Look at the popular reddit apps for ideas on a good UI. Great job with the instructions darkening the entire screen except the focal region. Good UX decision there.

Thanks for the feedback. We will take it into consideration during the redesign. However, HN is a reader app and some of the points you address will only clutter the interface (e.g. up-vote button always visible). The app is open source and we invite you to contribute, by suggesting features over at github or even fixing some of the reported ones.

title: The best way to read HN on Android. I use it every day... okay, every hour.

title: Crap.
comment: In-App web browser. What's wrong with you guys?

I don't think anything is wrong with us :). You can long press on each article and open it with the system browser.
The project is open sourced, so if you want something different, we invite you to contribute or make your own fork.
If you have specific feedback we will be happy to consider it within the next version.

title: Good but...
comment: Pros: - open source, no ads - share/save to several services - unintrussive, does what it says  Cons: - No way to mark all news as read. Next time you refresh, you will need to know where you left off and work out on your own what was the last read item and where the new ones begin. Kind of annoying. Devs, is it difficult to implement a "Mark all as read" feature? I like the app and I would like to stick to it.

Hi Vijay, thanks for the report! This was introduced by a new feature. I fixed it and uploaded a new version (should be online in 1-2 hours), can you please send me an email to hi@creativepragmatics.com if your problem has been fixed with the update? Thanks!

title: Great reader

title: Love it
comment: Great work. I have only one small suggestion: put the more action item (the 3 dots one) at the end of actionbar not before other items. This is just plain android ui guideline :)

Thanks for the suggestion. The reason that the synchronize button is right-most is that it is the most relevant button to the user. I can't find the part in the UI guidelines where it says that the overflow button HAS to be rightmost - can you point me to it?

title: No comments?
comment: I can't figure out a way to comment. I am very tech savvy and if it's not intuitive to my ability it probably needs work. That or its not a feature.

Hey Hector, commenting is the next big feature on the todo list - it has been for quite a while, because maintaining an open source app is not what I get paid for to do. It's currently not a feature, and the app's description does not claim it does.

title: Good work! But, some flaws
comment: I wish there were options to make the color scheme less terrible - I really don't like the background color. Also, I feel like collapsing a post should hide that posts text as well as its children. Finally, no way to copy text in a comment. Otherwise, good job!

Hi Omar! I'm sorry that you don't like the background color. It's a color very similar to the background color that news.ycombinator.com uses, for obvious reasons. Collapsing a node is usually meant to collapse its child nodes, not the node itself - it's called "collapse" and not "hide" for a reason. I'll have a look at copying within comments.

title: Good but issues
comment: I appreciate trying to work with Hacker News as a data source must be horribly frustrating, this app does a great job overall. The only weirdness I see is with comment view. If I have previously commented on an article, I only see a blank page for comments. I also increasingly see blank pages even on articles I haven't commented on. Aside from this, great app many thanks to the dev.

Hi Daniel, this should not happen. It might be related to your internet connection or the increasing number of very-large-threads on hacker news. We have recently improved the parsing logic - could you please check again whether your problems are still there?

title: Great App for Hacker News!
comment: Title says it all. Works very well, the best way to read hacker news without a doubt.

title: Missing timestamp
comment: Can you add info on how long ago the articles were posted? Otherwise excellent app!
I have omitted this information because most users don't need it, and it would bloat the UI a lot. You are the first one to ask this, btw.

title: Wonderful app!
comment: Thanks for the bug fixes!

title: What's with the loading animation?
comment: This is a great app, but in what universe is a loading animation that fills the entire view a good idea?  Edit: thanks for the update! New review: this is a great app.
Hehe thanks. This was related to an Android 4.3 bug, I worked around it in the current release.

comment: While loading a page it reloads it many times, sometimes in an endless loop. Even when pages do display correctly it takes forever. Many times I just give up, or email the link to myself to read outside of the HN reader. Poor performance. Uninstalling as it is almost unusable. 4.3.b stock GNexus.

HN uses the standard Android WebView, there's nothing I can do against slow loading of a articles. You are the only one reporting such an issue - perhaps you should just restart your phone and try again.

Sorry, that's a technical limitation, due to the way the Hacker News site works (expiring tokens etc). The app allowed more than one "More" tap some months ago, but I got a lot of negative feedback because it did often fail. It can't be fixed currently.

title: My favorite so far
comment: All it lacks is log-in capability to comment and upvote posts/comments. Also the comments' formatting appears a bit messed up - perhaps this is fine for phones but I have plenty of screen space on this tablet :-)
Login and upvoting works now, commenting coming soon :)

title: Needs an update
comment: Only shows the very first page... the more button rarely works
Fixed :)
Brilliant and beautiful

title: Excellent
comment: This has the best ui out of all the HN apps I've tried.

title: Very good
comment: I'm using this app for about one month, I'm very satisfied, it does what I want and is pleasant to use.  The only feature I'm missing in resizable text in comments view. But yes, I know, I should buy glasses.

title: Fantastic
comment: Looks great, works well, well thought out

title: Perfet
comment: Perfect app. Simple,  well laid out,  easy to use.

title: Best one around
comment: The best and most simple application to read hacker news comfortably, works beautyfully on tablets!

title: Finally
comment: Great app. Only request is to mark articles that I've already read to be highlighted in a different color!

title: Best HN Reader
comment: This is absolutly awesome.

title: Looks good, even in compatibility mode.
comment: Nicely done. Hopefully people will chip in at github.
Very good

title: Best HN client
comment: Awesome

title: Most beautiful
comment: Well done, please allow more posts to show

title: Awesome.
comment: Works! Great UI too.
